title: Person filed bankruptcy on his previous name and also filed another one under new name. Is this a FEDERAL CRIME? See Bottom
question: Person filed for bankruptcy on his previous name under different social security and date of birth. Judge then ordered him for deportation after his case failed. Person did not leave instead he changed his identity under different name, date of birth and got new social security number. A while later, he filed for another bankruptcy under his new identity. Biometric Fingerprints is the evidence. Question is, Is it a FEDERAL CRIME penalty if a person filed two bankruptcy under two identities??
answers: Bankruptcy petitions are signed under penalty of perjury, which is a crime.
Give this information to the US Trustee in San Jose. They will likely conduct an investigation and take appropriate action.
